typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Init: Initial owner cannot be zero address"

arguments.value: Init: Initial owner cannot be zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Init: Initial owner cannot be zero address"

documentation.text: @dev Sets the initial owner and default admin roles for manageable roles.
@dev Grants a *manageable* `role` (NOT ADMIN_ROLE). Reverts if role is ADMIN_ROLE.
@dev Revokes a *manageable* `role` (NOT ADMIN_ROLE). Reverts if role is ADMIN_ROLE.
@dev Sets the admin role for a *manageable* `role` (NOT ADMIN_ROLE). Requires owner.
@dev Sets default admin roles (owner manages others).
@dev Grants role in state map. Assumes role != ADMIN_ROLE.
@dev Revokes role from state map. Assumes role != ADMIN_ROLE.
@dev Sets role admin in state map. Assumes role != ADMIN_ROLE.
@dev Checks if sender can manage 'role'. Only called for non-ADMIN_ROLE.
@dev Checks role possession (implicit ADMIN_ROLE for owner, explicit for others).

devdoc.details: Provides role-based access control where the contract owner ALWAYS implicitly holds ADMIN_ROLE.      ADMIN_ROLE is not stored in the roles mapping and cannot be granted or revoked.      Other roles are explicitly managed via the _roles mapping and admin hierarchy.
devdoc.title: AccessControlWithOwner (V5 - Strict Implicit Owner Admin)

userdoc.notice: Owner's ADMIN_ROLE status is inherent and immutable.         Storage layout (owner, _roles, _roleAdmin) MUST be respected by proxies.
